scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You decided to help your colleague Mark this time but asked him to handle such tasks without you while you are on leave. Now, a few hours later, you find yourself discussing this situation with Monica and Bob over a video call.
scenes.description: [Monica]: 'I can't believe Mark asked you to work during your leave. That's so inconsiderate.' [Bob]: 'Yeah, but sometimes work emergencies happen. How did you handle it, Alex?' You: 'I told Mark I’d help this time but asked him to handle such tasks without me in the future.' [Monica]: 'Did Mark at least thank you?' [Bob]: 'And did he promise not to bother you again?'

options.text: Mark was grateful, but I hope he learned to respect my boundaries.
options.analysis: You showed good emotional perception and social skills by addressing the situation clearly and setting boundaries, although your empathy and self-regulation could be slightly improved.

options.text: He thanked me, but I made it clear that my time off should be respected.
options.analysis: You maintained strong self-regulation by setting clear boundaries, but your empathy and motivation towards the team’s urgent needs were lower.

options.text: He did appreciate my help, but it seemed like he didn't fully get the message.
options.analysis: You showed high empathy and emotional perception by acknowledging Mark's gratitude, but your self-regulation was low as it appears the message about your boundaries wasn't fully communicated.
